headline: NBM felicitates with Benin monarch over return of artifacts
summarized_story:

In a statement by the Public Relations Officer of NBM in the zone, Moses Idahosa, the group also commended President Muhammadu Buhari for ensuring that the artifacts were returned to the palace of the Oba of Benin where they were looted.
READ ALSO:How Oba Ewuare II received Benin artefacts looted 125 years agoIt said: “No doubt, the arrival of the two artifacts is not only historic and symbolic but has also further expanded the splendor of other artifacts in the palace, and we pray for the urgent return of over 10, 000 other Benin looted artifacts currently domiciled in over 145 Museums across Europe and the US.
“We call on other institutions and authorities holding unto other looted Benin artifacts to emulate the kind and noble gesture of Jesuit College of Cambridge University, and the University of Aberdeen, Scotland and return Benin artifacts in their possession, as it will be a de-service to the black-race and humanity at large if the artifacts are not returned to the Oba Palace, their original abode.
The Zonal PRO averred that the Benin artifacts transcend beyond mere artworks, as they are symbols of traditional heritage of the Great Benin Kingdom which must not be allowed to be domiciled outside the palace of the Oba.

headline: FG to collaborate with Republic of Korea in tackling unemployment

headline: Gov Emmanuel reacts to death of Pastor Ezekiel Atang
summarized_story:
The Governor of Akwa Ibom State, Mr Udom Emmanuel, has commiserated with the family of late Pastor Ezekiel Atang, a renowned preacher in the state.
Atang, until his death two days ago, was the General Overseer of the God’s House of Refuge, Uyo .

Commodore Ayo-Vaughan, who holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Chemistry and a Masters Degree in International Affairs and Diplomacy from Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria, is a member of the 43rd Regular Course of the Nigerian Defence Academy.
The statement further added that Commodore Ayo-Vaughan attended the French War College (Ecole de Guerre), Paris, France for his strategic course after obtained a Masters in Defence Management, Command and Strategy, Ecole de Guerre, France and Post Graduate Certificate in Data Science and Business Analytics from the University of Texas, USA.

headline: Fuel scarcity: NSCDC warns petrol dealers, consumers against sharp practices

headline: Biden orders deployment of troops in Eastern Europe amid Ukraine-Russia crisis
summarized_story:
US President Joe Biden says the country will deploy additional troops and equipment to Baltic members of the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation (NATO) in Eastern Europe.
The development is coming hours after Russian President Vladimir Putin reportedly ordered troops into two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine.
The Baltic states — Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania — are the only ex-soviet countries to have joined the European Union (EU) and NATO — which Ukraine aims to join.
Speaking on Tuesday at a media briefing, Biden said the “United States will continue to provide defensive assistance to Ukraine in the meantime”, adding that the US will also “continue to reinforce and reassure our NATO allies”.
We want to send an unmistakable message that the United States together with our allies will defend every inch of NATO territory and abide by the commitments we made it to NATO.

Hong Kong has reported about 5,000 new daily infections since Feb. 15, with the number threatening to overwhelm its healthcare system.
Since the surge began at the beginning of the year, the city has recorded nearly 54,000 cases and 145 deaths.
The order for citywide testing comes after mainland Chinese authorities dispatched health workers and medical resources last week to help contain the outbreak in the semi-autonomous Chinese city.

headline: Oil Hits Highest Since 2014 on Russia-Ukraine Escalation
summarized_story:
“The potential for a rally over $100 a barrel has received an enormous boost,” said Tamas Varga of oil broker PVM.
U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude jumped $4.41, or 4.8%, to $95.48 versus Friday’s settlement, having earlier reached $96, also the highest since 2014.
The crisis over Ukraine has added further support to an oil market that has surged due to tight supplies as demand recovers from the coronavirus pandemic.
The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and allies, known as OPEC+, have resisted calls to boost supply more rapidly.
Talks are ongoing on renewing Iran’s nuclear agreement with world powers, which could eventually boost Iran’s oil exports by over 1 million barrels per day.

headline: Russia Faces New Sanctions after Putin Recognise Breakaway Ukraine Regions
summarized_story:
The United States and its European allies are set to announce fresh sanctions against Russia on Tuesday after President Vladimir Putin recognised two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine, deepening Western fears of a new war in Europe.
A senior British government minister said it was clear Putin had chosen confrontation over dialogue and Britain would respond with sanctions.
He said the situation was as grave as the 1962 Cuban missile crisis when a confrontation between the United States and the Soviet Union brought the world to the brink of nuclear war.
European Union member states’ ambassadors will meet to discuss possible sanctions with limited sanctions a possible option, an EU official said.
Russia annexed Crimea from Ukraine in 2014, and Western countries imposed sanctions on Russia.
